summary: The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) conducts financial management reviews to verify states' appropriate spending of federal Medicaid funds. Since FY2016, CMS started 49 financial management reviews, usually focused on one state. As of June 2020, most reviews were still ongoing. Some states won't address the problems identified until the reviews are done, leaving federal and state dollars at risk for misspending. What...
title: Medicaid Program Integrity: Action Needed to Ensure CMS Completes Financial Management Reviews in a Timely Manner
